title: Activity-Based Learning Design for Youth Soccer Coaching

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Blended education courses conducted in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment

learning_goals: Learners can design at least 60% of a youth soccer team’s training time using Activity-Based Learning (Active Decision-Making).
Learners can analyze differences in national youth soccer coaching approaches (UK, Germany, Portugal, Spain).
Learners can develop a training program centered on Small-Sided Games applicable to actual match situations.

resources: Country-specific coaching case study PDF resource pack
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
